p: The yield of oil obtained of P. orientalis leaves was 0.5% (w/v). This amount is similar to recent study ( 17) but relatively higher than other studies ( 22, 25, 30, 31). According to our results, α-Pinene (20.17%), 3-Carene (14%) and Cedrol (9.51%) are known as the main compounds of the oil. Similar to those previously reported ( 17, 26, 30, 31), the major constituents were α-pinene, 3-carene and cedrol. However, there were differences in the amount of the main components. The differences in the number of compositions in the above-mentioned studies may be due to the collection time and geographic factors ( 26).
